Software System: The Prosecution module of the CCTNS
The Citizen Interface module of the CCTNS
The reading and understanding of the textual content on the screen
Environment Object: MINISTRY OF HOME AFFAIRS GOVERNMENT OF INDIA
External System: the standard for guidance on ICT accessibility
System Requirements: the first version of the CCTNS
records room staff and citizens within the broad crime investigation area
the approach, interaction and information exchange between police and complainants
to record entries of the court interactions
information exchange between citizens and police units/personnel
respond to citizens with very little turnaround time
The support solution should be accessible to the users both from within the application and also outside the application through a browser interface.
automatically capturing and storing information about the user initiating and or carrying out the action
automatically capturing and storing information about the date and time of the event
unalterable audit trail capable of automatically capturing and storing information about administrative parameters
audit trail data is available for inspection on request
a specific event can be identified and all related data made accessible
export audit trails for specified cases
the requirements to control the user access to correspondences, files, and records and various functionalities
allow the user to limit access to cases to specified users or user groups
a user to be a member of more than one group
allow a user to stipulate which other users or groups can access cases
allow changes to security attributes for groups or users
log these in the audit trail
familiar and common look and feel
the interfaces must be made customizable or user-configurable to the extent possible
suitable for users with special needs
Navigation should be designed to help users understand where they are, where they have been and where they can go next
Splash screens should be avoided unless they provide useful content or feedback about the application state
Horizontal scrolling should be avoided wherever possible.
ability to choose between different input devices for activating controls such as links, fields and buttons
User interfaces should be designed to be as robust as possible in the face of changing technology.
Text should be able to be resized by the user

The reading and understanding of the textual content on the screen should be supported by suitable means, including the use of short sentences, the division of the text into shorter chunks or the presentation of content items in the form of bullet points.
Fast skimming of text should be supported
Navigation links should be clearly distinguishable from controls
The length of a page should be selected so as to support the primary purpose and use of the page.
Page titles should be placed in a consistent location
Navigation components should be placed consistently

monitoring the user’s behaviour and adapting to the user’s goals that are inferred from the behaviour observed, recommending information that is potentially more relevant or interesting to the specific user, based on the behaviour of all users or a user group
the number of incidents of unplanned downtime
provide adequate response times for commonly performed functions
the case which has been accessed within the previous 2 months
regardless of storage capacity or number of cases in the CCTNS system
retrieve and display within 20 seconds the case which has not been accessed within the previous 2 months
leverage advancement in open standards and web technologies
the deployment of the application will be at state level and will be configured and customized as per the state specific extensions
The CCTNS systems should be designed with the following broad guidelines:
work even in an offline mode with the critical functionality
for a centralized deployment and maintenance
to have a n-tier architecture with the presentation logic separated from the business logic that is again separated from the data-access logic
to provide access to the interfaces
multiple types of communication services for remote access
public access to a subset of data and functionality
selective encryption of the stored data
high standards of security and access control
perform only soft tagging the row for deletion
fields that need to be displayed to the user
the aim and purpose of the system to be developed
Shared Phenomena: search for a particular person, type of crime, modus operandi, property etc.
respond to citizens with very little turnaround time
all the possible actions and scenarios on all user interfaces in the application
all other activities involving the cases and related documents or data
the displayed columns in the table
the expected range of technical contexts of use
the target or purpose of a link
HTTP over an encrypted secure socket layer (SSL)
secure transmission of data over the network
records on the screen in batches/paged manner
